intro: Ionidium diffusum, commonly known as the spreading ionidium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
